Major_Arcs.title: Ghost Town and Saloon - Setting the Stage
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces the setting of the story in a Western 'Ghost Town' saloon, establishing the atmosphere and initial character interactions.

sub_scenes.title: Saloon Scene and Initial Conversations
sub_scenes.description: The story opens in a saloon, introducing various characters and setting the scene. Initial dialogues hint at personal conflicts and the town's atmosphere.

narrative_arcs.title: Saloon Scene Setting
The Blonde Woman's Explanation
Conversation Continues - Man's Response and Old Timers' Wisdom

sub_scenes.title: Arrival of Modern Surveyors and Demolition Plan
sub_scenes.description: The narrative shifts to introduce modern surveyors arriving at the Ghost Town with plans to build an airport, revealing the impending destruction of the town and the emotional reactions to this plan.

narrative_arcs.title: Cowboy's Farewell and Nostalgic Reflection
Modern Arrival and Ghost Town Observation
Airport Plan and Town Demolition Imminent
Emotional Reaction to Ghost Town's Destruction

Major_Arcs.title: Nan and Cal's Relationship and the Demolition Fallout
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on the personal relationship between Nan and Cal amidst the backdrop of the Ghost Town demolition, highlighting their conflicts and emotional responses to the town's fate.

sub_scenes.title: Nan and Cal's Argument and Woman's Distress
sub_scenes.description: Nan confronts Cal about their relationship, while a surveyor woman expresses deep distress over the planned demolition of the Ghost Town.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan's Accusation and Cal's Defense
Woman's Reflection on Past Relationship with Cal
Ghost Town Demolition and Woman's Outburst

sub_scenes.title: Business Discussions and Father-Daughter Conflict
sub_scenes.description: Business discussions about cattle and the airport ensue, leading to conflict between Nan and her father regarding horses for construction, further straining Nan's emotional state.

narrative_arcs.title: Cattle Shipping and Airport Business Discussion
Horses for Construction and Father-Daughter Conflict

sub_scenes.title: Reassurance, Resolve and Cal's Departure
sub_scenes.description: Nan receives reassurance about Cal's love from her parents and maid, yet she resolves to seek clarity directly from Cal, leading to a chase and business interruption before Cal departs.

narrative_arcs.title: Reassurance of Cal's Love
Nan's Resolve to Seek Clarity
Chasing Cal
Horse Business Interruption
Business Deal and Commitment
Intense Conversation and Impending Departure
Cal's Departure
Reaction to Departing Horses

sub_scenes.title: Time Skip, Longing and Romantic Reunion
sub_scenes.description: A time skip reveals Nan's longing for Cal during his absence, culminating in Cal's return and confession of love, resolving their romantic tension amidst the backdrop of the changing town.

narrative_arcs.title: Time Skip and Nan's Longing Narration
Cal's Return and Confession of Love
Reunion and Unease in the Snow

Major_Arcs.title: The Snowstorm and Community Crisis
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts the sudden onset of a severe snowstorm, the immediate crisis it causes for the livestock and community, and the collective response to survive.

sub_scenes.title: Arrival of Snowstorm and Initial Concerns
sub_scenes.description: A severe snowstorm hits the Ghost Town, and the community grapples with the immediate threat to livestock and their livelihoods.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival at the Snowy Homestead and Weather Report
Concern Over Livestock and Fodder Shortage
Assessing the Snow's Severity and Nan's Concern
Narrative Description of Relentless Snowfall
Cal's Decisive Action to Save the Cattle

sub_scenes.title: Despair, Hope and Resolution through Community Aid
sub_scenes.description: Despair turns to hope with the arrival of a plane carrying fodder, showcasing community resilience and leading to a romantic reaffirmation between Nan and Cal amidst the crisis.

narrative_arcs.title: Indoor Despair and a Glimmer of Hope
Plane Arrives with Fodder
Hope and Romantic Reassurance

Major_Arcs.title: Cowtown Showdown and Character Judgments
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts the setting to 'Cowtown' and introduces Chane Benson through a dramatic showdown, exploring varied public opinions and judgments about his character and actions.

sub_scenes.title: Showdown and Public Reaction in Cowtown
sub_scenes.description: Chane Benson is introduced through a street fight in Cowtown, with onlookers providing diverse commentary on his character and actions.

narrative_arcs.title: Showdown and Reactions in Cowtown
Debate on Chane Benson's Character
Dismissive Reaction and Age Critique

Major_Arcs.title: Jeff's Gun Obsession and Confrontation with Benson
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc centers around Jeff's fascination with guns and his admiration for figures like Clyde Surratt, leading to a confrontation related to Chane Benson and culminating in a plan to help Jeff.

sub_scenes.title: Jeff's Gun Play and Sally's Concern
sub_scenes.description: Sally reflects on Jeff's behavior and confronts him about his gun obsession, revealing her deep concern and initiating a plan with Pete to help him.

narrative_arcs.title: Reminiscing About Jeff's Childhood
Gun Obsession Critique
Confrontation over Gun Cleaning
Lectures and Disobedience
Plea for Decency
Clyde Surratt Admiration
Boasting and Challenge to Clyde Surratt
Violent Threat and Laughter
Planning to Help Jeff
Reaffirming Love and Duty Towards Jeff

sub_scenes.title: Introduction of Mr. Benson and Ominous Presence
sub_scenes.description: Mr. Benson is introduced, and his unsettling demeanor is described, foreshadowing potential danger and conflict related to his character.

narrative_arcs.title: Introduction of Mr. Benson and Sarcastic Remark
Narrative Reflection on Shane Benson's Demeanor

sub_scenes.title: Article Controversy and Benson's Response
sub_scenes.description: An article written by Clyde about Chane Benson sparks fear and confrontation, leading to Benson's explanation for staying in town and his intentions.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation about the Article
Sally's Fear and Clyde's Reassurance
Benson's Confrontation and Justification for Staying
Benson Justifies His Stance and Criticizes Clyde
Sally and Surrett Discuss Clyde's Article and Benson's Impact
Considering Inviting Chane Benson for Dinner
Discussing Chane's Skills and Dinner Invitation

sub_scenes.title: Dinner Invitation, Jealousy and Violent Outburst
sub_scenes.description: A polite dinner invitation leads to a moonlit walk, which is abruptly interrupted by Jeff's jealous confrontation, escalating into physical aggression and a forced kiss.

narrative_arcs.title: Polite Conversation and Departure for Moonlight Walk
Jeff's Jealous Confrontation
Escalating Aggression and Unwanted Kiss
Sally's Angry Retort and Accusations
Post-Kiss Conversation and Jeff's Justification
Chane's Retaliation and Threat, Sally's Urgent Plea
Desperate Ride to Save Clyde
Confrontation Inside the Newspaper Office
Benson's Challenge and Chane's Departure with Clyde
Anxious Wait and Sally's Regret
Headline Change Order
Newspaper Partnership and Sally's Pride

Major_Arcs.title: Ranch Troubles and Betsy & Steve's Romance
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Betsy and Steve, setting up ranch troubles and developing their romantic relationship against a backdrop of conflict and suspicion.

sub_scenes.title: Ranch Introduction and Initial Unease
sub_scenes.description: Betsy encounters ranch troubles and meets Steve Daley, the new boss, developing an initial unease despite others' reassurances.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation and Gender Insult
Introduction of Steve Daley as the Boss
Discussion of Trouble with the New Boss
Initial Interaction and Betsy's Unease with Steve
Ranch Troubles and Suspicions of Double K
Trip to Town and Hank's Orders for Betsy

sub_scenes.title: Town Confrontation and Bar Fight
sub_scenes.description: Betsy faces confrontation in town, while a separate bar fight scene provides a contrasting perspective on violence and gunfighters.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation with Fred Bridges at the Store
Bar Fight and Aftermath

sub_scenes.title: Betsy's Decision, Change of Heart and Love Confession
sub_scenes.description: Betsy initially decides to fire Steve but changes her mind, leading to a confession of love and a pivotal decision about Steve's gunfighting identity.

narrative_arcs.title: Betsy's Realization about Steve and Ranch Decision
Betsy's Change of Heart and Hank's Suggestion
Betsy's Confession to Steve
Negotiating Terms and Gunfighter Identity
Love Confession and a Difficult Request
The Ultimate Proof of Love and a Kiss

sub_scenes.title: Devil's Pass Confrontation and Romantic Reunion
sub_scenes.description: Escalating ranch conflict leads to a confrontation at Devil's Pass, violence and a surprising romantic reunion between Betsy and Steve amidst the chaos.

narrative_arcs.title: Accusations and Demands at the Ranch
Escalating Threats and Betsy's Firm Stance
Reflection on Violence and Foreshadowing of Attack
Betsy's Plea and Hank's Determination
Desperate Plea and Steve's Resolve
Betsy's Contemplation and Impending Action
Ride to Devil's Pass and Ceasefire
Arrival at Devil's Pass and Initial Confrontation
Capture, Debate, and Shooting of Steve
Betsy's Faint and Reunion with Steve
Relief and Reflection on Survival
Romantic Declaration and Future Together

Major_Arcs.title: Carrie, Dave and Fred's Love Triangle and Business Conflict
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc explores a complex love triangle between Carrie, Dave, and Fred, intertwined with business dealings and emotional betrayals, leading to a confrontation and eventual resolution.

sub_scenes.title: Rebuke, Flashback and Ranch Conflict Introduction
sub_scenes.description: Carrie rebukes Dave, followed by a flashback introducing Curley and the conflict arising from new fences affecting ranch land.

narrative_arcs.title: Dave's Sulking and Rebuke
Flashback to Curley's Arrival at the Corral
News of Fencing and Range Trouble
Ranchers Discuss the New Fence
Confrontation at the Fence Line
Planning to Secure the Herd
Escalating Tension with Fred Gordon
Curley Intervenes to Prevent Violence
Disarming and Expulsion of Fred Gordon and Brother
Aftermath and Assertion of Ranch Ownership

sub_scenes.title: Conflicted Feelings and Brotherly Reconciliation
sub_scenes.description: Carrie and Dave discuss their feelings and relationship with Fred, leading to a brotherly reconciliation between Dave and Fred and hinting at a budding romance between Carrie and Fred.

narrative_arcs.title: Reluctant Friendship and Brotherly Disdain
Defense of Fred's Actions and Implicit Feelings
Confession of Conflicted Feelings
Seeking Honesty and Deeper Conversation
Affirmation of the Current Relationship
Internal Monologue of Perceived Unspoken Love
Sudden Interruption and Confrontational Inquiry
Accusation and Defensive Stance
Attempt to De-escalate and Initial Refusal
Accusation of Heartbreak and Questioning Conclusions
Declaration of Possessiveness and Protectiveness
Confession of Love Trigger and Reassurance
Brotherly Reconciliation and Movie Invitation
Flashback of Budding Romance and Anticipation
Marriage Proposal and Acceptance

sub_scenes.title: Business Deal, Betrayal and Confrontation with Carlton
sub_scenes.description: Fred reveals the importance of the Carlton contract, leading to Carrie feeling betrayed and confronting Mr. Carlton about perceived trickery, followed by emotional fallout and reconciliation with Dave.

narrative_arcs.title: Concern and Misinterpretation Regarding Dave's Feelings
Clarification of Misunderstanding and Business Motives
Revelation of Selfishness and Business Priority
Angry Accusation of Deception and Trickery
Desperate Plea and Rejection of Affection
Internal Reflection on Suspicion and Motivation
Confrontation and Inquiry about Intentions
Anticipation and Impatience Before Confrontation
Direct Confrontation with Mr. Carlton
Accusation of Trickery and Business Betrayal
Defiant Assertion of Independence and Self-Reliance
Emotional Aftermath and Reflection of Foolishness
Reconciliation and Comfort in Affection
Relief and Lingering Pain After Decision
Distant Reunion in Town After Weeks Apart
Inquiry and Confirmation of Love
Riding Back and Discussing Past and Present Feelings

Major_Arcs.title: Dirk and Rance's Story: Escape, Pursuit and Reconciliation
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on Dirk's escape and pursuit by Rance, culminating in a violent confrontation, Dirk's capture and a surprising reconciliation and romantic resolution for Rance and Chris.

sub_scenes.title: Urgent Summons and Discovery of Injury
sub_scenes.description: Chris urgently summons Dirk, leading to the discovery of Dirk's gunshot wound and initial medical assessment.

narrative_arcs.title: Bedroom Interruption and Urgent Summons
Discovery of Gunshot Wound and Reassurance
Discussion about Dirk's Fight and Empty Gun
Marshal Rance Cready's Arrival and Ranch Confrontation
Concern for Injured Man and Introduction of Dirk's Situation
Debate on Duty, Justice, and Decision to Stay for Dirk
Romantic Reconciliation after Argument
Urgent Plea to Rescue Dirk
Contemplating Rescue Strategy and Legal Implications

sub_scenes.title: Escape, Pursuit, Confrontation and Capture
sub_scenes.description: Dirk's escape and the ensuing pursuit by the Marshal lead to a violent confrontation, Dirk shooting the Marshal and ultimately being captured.

narrative_arcs.title: Escape and Pursuit Begins
Failed Evasion and Pursuit Persistence
Confrontation, Shooting, and Aid
Disagreement on Fate of the Marshal
Departure and Difficult Decision
Confession of Love and Understanding
Rance's Defiance and Acceptance of Escape
Rance's Awakening and Father's Relief
Doctor's Inquiry and Father's Explanation
Confession and Proposal
Mary and Chris's Confessions and Fears
Wedding Day is Here, but Dirk is Missing
Dirk Interrupts the Wedding and Confrontation
Marshal's Plan, Dirk's Capture and Backstory Revealed
